  • Method Details

    • getDriverUrl

      private static java.net.URL getDriverUrl()

    • createWinAppDriver

      protected static org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver createWinAppDriver()
      Returns a newly created WindowsDriver as a WebDriver, based on the currently active page object and environment. If the WinAppDriver.exe program is not started, it also starts that.

      Note: This method cannot tell if WinAppDriver.exe has already been started externally and will create a port conflict if it is already running.

      Returns:
      WebDriver returns a WindowsDriver<WebElement>

    • quit

      protected static void quit​(io.appium.java_client.windows.WindowsDriver<io.appium.java_client.windows.WindowsElement> driver)
      Quits the WindowsDriver process passed to it. If this is the last remaining WinAppDriver running, the WinAppDriver.exe executable is also stopped.
      Parameters:
      driver - WindowsDriver<WebElement> the WindowsDriver to quit

    • startWinAppDriverExe

      private static void startWinAppDriverExe()
      Starts the WinAppDriver executable program if it is not running so that Windows programs can be driven using it. Sets the winAppDrvierProcess member variable to be the running process. Future optimizations of this method are tracked in issues #284 and #285.

    • stopWinAppDriverExe

      private static void stopWinAppDriverExe()
      Stops WinAppDriver running if it is running and sets the WinAppDriverProcess member variable to null so that we know we need to start it up again if necessary.

    • isReady

      private static boolean isReady​(long pid)

    • waitForDriverReady

      private static void waitForDriverReady​(long pid)
